trans-unit.source: With Windows 10, the graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.
trans-unit.target: With Windows 10, the graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.

trans-unit.source: To use the graphics diagnostic features provided in the runtime and Visual Studio to develop DirectX apps or games, install the optional Graphics Tools feature:
trans-unit.target: To use the graphics diagnostic features provided in the runtime and Visual Studio to develop DirectX apps or games, install the optional Graphics Tools feature:

trans-unit.source: Go to **Settings**, select **System**, select **Optional features**, and then click **Add a feature**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Settings**, select **System**, select **Optional features**, and then click **Add a feature**.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Settings**, select **System**, select **Apps & features**, select **Manage optional features**, and then click **Add a feature**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Settings**, select **System**, select **Apps & features**, select **Manage optional features**, and then click **Add a feature**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add a Feature** list, click **Graphics Tools**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add a Feature** list, click **Graphics Tools**.

trans-unit.source: Graphics diagnostics features include the ability to create Direct3D debug devices (via Direct3D SDK Layers) in the DirectX runtime, plus Graphics Debugging, Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage.
trans-unit.target: Graphics diagnostics features include the ability to create Direct3D debug devices (via Direct3D SDK Layers) in the DirectX runtime, plus Graphics Debugging, Frame Analysis, and GPU Usage.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Debugging lets you trace the Direct3D calls being made by your app.
trans-unit.target: Graphics Debugging lets you trace the Direct3D calls being made by your app.

trans-unit.source: Then, you can replay those calls, inspect parameters, debug and experiment with shaders, and visualize graphics assets to diagnose rendering issues.
trans-unit.target: Then, you can replay those calls, inspect parameters, debug and experiment with shaders, and visualize graphics assets to diagnose rendering issues.

trans-unit.source: Logs can be taken on Windows PCs, simulators, or devices, and be played back on different hardware.
trans-unit.target: Logs can be taken on Windows PCs, simulators, or devices, and be played back on different hardware.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Frame Analysis in Visual Studio runs on a graphics debugging log and gathers baseline timing for the Direct3D draw calls.
trans-unit.target: Graphics Frame Analysis in Visual Studio runs on a graphics debugging log and gathers baseline timing for the Direct3D draw calls.

trans-unit.source: It then performs a set of experiments by modifying various graphics settings and produces a table of timing results.
trans-unit.target: It then performs a set of experiments by modifying various graphics settings and produces a table of timing results.

trans-unit.source: You can use this data to understand graphics performance issues in your app, and you can review results of the various experiments to identify opportunities for performance improvements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this data to understand graphics performance issues in your app, and you can review results of the various experiments to identify opportunities for performance improvements.

trans-unit.source: GPU Usage in Visual Studio allows you to monitor GPU use in real time.
trans-unit.target: GPU Usage in Visual Studio allows you to monitor GPU use in real time.

trans-unit.source: It collects and analyzes the timing data of the workloads being handled by the CPU and GPU, so you can determine where the bottlenecks are.
trans-unit.target: It collects and analyzes the timing data of the workloads being handled by the CPU and GPU, so you can determine where the bottlenecks are.
